description: Starting point: we have a problem. Yes, we do Where I argue that there are no digital scholarly edition of a classical text with a multi-testimonial tradition (and I explain what I mean by that). Where I argue that there are no digital scholarly edition of a classical text with a multi-testimonial tradition (and I explain what I mean by that). Point 1: We don't have classical digital scholarly editions because classicists just don't feel they need them

is_part_of.title: Opinion/Provocation: Why are there no digital scholarly editions of "classical" texts?

title: Starting point: we have a problem. Yes, we do
